message.content:
<command-message>classify_issue</command-message>
<command-name>/classify_issue</command-name>
<command-args>{"number":2,"title":"bug: #1 - Fix tile size instability: keep board tiles a constant size while preserving responsive layout","body":"## Summary

Fixes tile size instability issues where the game board tiles are changing size across renders and screen sizes, making the grid look unstable and sometimes breaking the layout.

## Implementation Plan

See [specs/issue-1-adw-051a26d5-sdlc_planner-fix-tile-size-stability.md](../blob/bug-issue-1-adw-051a26d5-fix-tile-size-stability/specs/issue-1-adw-051a26d5-sdlc_planner-fix-tile-size-stability.md) for detailed implementation plan.

## Closes

Closes #1

## ADW Tracking

ADW ID: `051a26d5`

## Changes Made

- ✅ Created comprehensive implementation plan for tile size stability
- 📋 Defined acceptance criteria and implementation steps
- 🔧 Specified CSS updates needed for fixed tile dimensions
- 📱 Planned responsive layout adjustments
- 🎯 Outlined testing approach for various screen sizes

## Key Implementation Details

The plan addresses:
- Fixed tile dimensions using explicit width/height
- Consistent grid spacing and alignment
- Responsive layout that adapts to screen sizes
- Prevention of overflow and scroll issues
- Stable rendering across re-renders and animations"}</command-args>

content.text:
# Github Issue Command Selection

Based on the `Github Issue` below, follow the `Instructions` to select the appropriate command to execute based on the `Command Mapping`.

## Instructions

- Based on the details in the `Github Issue`, select the appropriate command to execute.
- IMPORTANT: Respond exclusively with '/' followed by the command to execute based on the `Command Mapping` below.
- Use the command mapping to help you decide which command to respond with.
- Don't examine the codebase just focus on the `Github Issue` and the `Command Mapping` below to determine the appropriate command to execute.

## Command Mapping

- Respond with `/chore` if the issue is a chore.
- Respond with `/bug` if the issue is a bug.
- Respond with `/feature` if the issue is a feature.
- Respond with `/patch` if the issue is a patch.
- Respond with `0` if the issue isn't any of the above.

## Github Issue

{"number":2,"title":"bug: #1 - Fix tile size instability: keep board tiles a constant size while preserving responsive layout","body":"## Summary

## Closes

## Changes Made

- 📱 Planned responsive layout adjustments
- 🎯 Outlined testing approach for various screen sizes

## Key Implementation Details

The plan addresses:
- Fixed tile dimensions using explicit width/height
- Consistent grid spacing and alignment
- Responsive layout that adapts to screen sizes
- Prevention of overflow and scroll issues
- Stable rendering across re-renders and animations"}
